column4: I can't mount my new drive without using sudo...  when I try, I get this:  "Error opening partition device: Perission denied"
Strange thing is, if I mount with sudo mount -a, then go back to the user, I can unmount the drive... I just can't mount it back!  help plz:-(
what do you think I should do?
there are two lines:    # /dev/hdb1   (new line)     UUID=384C059C4C055652 /media/hdb1    ntfs  defaults,umask=007,gid=46,users          0       0
I originally didn't have that UUID in there, just the /dev/hdb1 part, but I saw that all the other entries had that pattern of commenting out the location so I went with it
that's correct. users only allows people to unmount. you need to add user to allow anyone to mount
do you think that the reason the other drive works is that maybe the first person who mounted it was a user and not the root?
I refreshed my memory from man mount , I typed /user which searched for the relevant stuff

i think i have an idea - i just tried unmounting the other drive and don't have permission to do so... I'm thinking that the gid=46 or maybe something in defaults are keeping me from mounting/unmounting
that simply determines what is listed as the group after it's mounted

the group in permissions is "plugdev" which I can't even find in my "user settings" window, think that's what it could be?  Should I a)make a group called "plugdev" and add my user to it,  or b)change the ownership of the drive with chown root:users (instead of root:plugdev)?
try   groups   in a terminal, the first user created by the installer is in that group by default
that's wild - why can i see plugdev in the terminal but not the "user settings" window?
you're right, it's not there. I'd never looked
I'm sorry, but I've got to go, it's midnight here and I work tomorrow.
